meanings.definition: Not acclimatized or accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The unacclimatized explorer shivered in the cold mountain air.
meanings.sent2: She felt unacclimatized to the hot desert weather.
meanings.sent3: The unacclimatized penguin tried to sunbathe in Antarctica.
meanings.sent4: His unacclimatized body rebelled against the sudden change in temperature.
meanings.sent5: The unacclimatized plants withered in the unfamiliar soil.

meanings.definition: Not adapted or adjusted to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The unacclimatized tourists struggled with the high altitude.
meanings.sent2: The unacclimatized animals sought shelter from the storm.
meanings.sent3: The unacclimatized computer crashed in the extreme heat.
meanings.sent4: Her unacclimatized car sputtered in the icy conditions.
meanings.sent5: The unacclimatized city dwellers found the rural life challenging.
